title: How to Find Mode, Median, Mean and Range

steps.title: Order the set of numbers.
steps.content: Order the set of numbers. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Identify the number that appears most often.
steps.content: Identify the number that appears most often. [2] X Research source This number is the mode of the given set of numbers.

steps.title: If the amount of numbers is odd, count equally sideways to find the number in the middle.
steps.content: If the amount of numbers is odd, count equally sideways to find the number in the middle. The middle number is the median of the given set of numbers. [3] X Research source

steps.title: If the amount of numbers is even, find the average of the 2 numbers in the middle.
steps.content: If the amount of numbers is even, find the average of the 2 numbers in the middle. This number is the median of the given set of numbers. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Divide the total by the amount of numbers in the set.
steps.content: Divide the total by the amount of numbers in the set. [5] X Research source The result is the mean (or average) of the given set of numbers.

steps.title: Find the highest and lowest number in the set.
steps.content: Find the highest and lowest number in the set.

steps.title: Find the difference between the highest and lowest number in the set.
steps.content: Find the difference between the highest and lowest number in the set. [6] X Research source The difference is the range of the given set of numbers.
